page.title: 03PLAS GWILYM QUARRY
page.content: The Plas Gwilym quarry opened in 1885 to provide stone for the sea wall in Colwyn Bay.Six acres of land are owned by the quarry,but only one acre is quarried.Once,they had to excavate to get under a road to quarry new land and this took eight months.The stone they quarry is limestone and they use low explosives to break the rock.They use a diamond circular saw to cut the stone.This gives the stone a square face.This stone was used in the building of Conway bridge and the new expressway.The greatest demand for stone is March to June.October to November is a less demanding period. The men start work at 6.30a.m.on most days but when something special is needed they work in two shifts, night and day.
